credential.helpText: Create a Service Account with a JSON private key and provide the JSON here. See Google Cloud docs for more info about creating a service account. These IAM roles are required: Compute Viewer (roles/compute.viewer), (Project) Viewer (roles/viewer), Kubernetes Engine Admin (roles/container.admin), Service Account User (roles/iam.serviceAccountUser). More info on roles can be found here.
credential.label: Service Account

description.cacerts: CA Certificates needed to verify the server's certificate
description.engine-install-url: Default Docker engine installation URL (for most node drivers)
description.engine-iso-url: Default OS installation URL (for vSphere driver)
description.engine-newest-version: The newest supported version of Docker at the time of this release.  A Docker version that does not satisfy supported docker range but is newer than this will be marked as untested
description.engine-supported-range: Semver range for supported Docker engine versions.  Versions which do not satisfy this range will be marked unsupported in the UI
description.ingress-ip-domain: Wildcard DNS domain to use for automatically generated Ingress hostnames. <ingress-name>.<namespace-name>.<ip address of ingress controller> will be added to the domain.
description.server-url: Default {appName} install url. Must be HTTPS. All nodes in your cluster must be able to reach this.
description.system-default-registry: Private registry to be used for all system Docker images
description.ui-index: HTML index location for the UI.

editApiKey.basicAuth: Access Key and Secret Key can be sent as the username and password for HTTP Basic auth to authorize requests.  You can also combine them to use as a Bearer token:

rule.mustRunAs: MustRunAs - Requires a range to be configured. Uses the first value of the range as the default. Validates against the configured range.
rule.mustRunAsNonRoot: MustRunAsNonRoot - Requires that the pod be submitted with a non-zero runAsUser or have the USER directive defined in the image. No default provided.
rule.runAsAny: RunAsAny - No default provided. Allows any runAsUser to be specified.

batchSize.detail: Pods will be started and stopped this many at a time

strategy.label: Upgrade Strategy

maxSurge.detail: The maximum number of pods allowed beyond the desired scale at any given time.

maxUnavailable.detail: The maximum number of pods which can be unavailable at any given time.

minReadySeconds.detail: Containers in the pods must be up for at least this long before the pod is considered available.
minReadySeconds.label: Minimum Ready Time

strategy.onDelete: Start upgraded pods only when old ones are manually deleted
strategy.orderedReady: Strict serial update in order and wait for readiness
strategy.parallel: Start all new and stop all old pods in parallel

progressDeadlineSeconds.detail: How long to wait without seeing progress before marking the deployment as stalled.
progressDeadlineSeconds.label: Progress Deadline

strategy.recreate: Kill ALL pods, then start new
strategy.startFirst: Rolling: start new pods, then stop old
strategy.stopFirst: Rolling: stop old pods, then start new

connecting.warning: Unable to establish a WebSocket connection to the server.  If your server is behind a proxy or SSL-termination device, Browser can not connect to WebSocket. If you run the server behind a proxy, please make sure the proxy supports WebSockets.  Streaming stats, logs, shell/console, and auto-updating of the state of resources may not work until this is resolved.

rkeConfigComment.ingress:
""
"  # Currently only nginx ingress provider is supported."
"  # To disable ingress controller, set `provider: none`"
"  # To enable ingress on specific nodes, use the node_selector, eg:"
"     provider: nginx"
"     node_selector:"
"       app: ingress"
rkeConfigComment.network:
""
"  # If you are using calico on AWS"
""
"     network:"
"       plugin: calico"
"       calico_network_provider:"
"         cloud_provider: aws"
""
"  # To specify flannel interface"
""
"     network:"
"       plugin: flannel"
"       flannel_network_provider:"
"         iface: eth1"
""
"  # To specify flannel interface for canal plugin"
""
"     network:"
"       plugin: canal"
"       canal_network_provider:"
"         iface: eth1"
rkeConfigComment.services:
""
"     services:"
"       kube_api:"
"         service_cluster_ip_range: 10.43.0.0/16"
"       kube_controller:"
"         cluster_cidr: 10.42.0.0/16"
"         service_cluster_ip_range: 10.43.0.0/16"
"       kubelet:"
"         cluster_domain: cluster.local"
"         cluster_dns_server: 10.43.0.10"
